attributes.action: Allow pets to travel freely between the UK and Europe with proper documentation.
attributes.additional_details: I urge the UK government to reassess pet travel restrictions that challenge pet owners. Allowing pets to travel between the UK and Continental Europe with valid health documentation would promote family unity and responsible ownership. A trial program at key airports, such as Liverpool, would be a valuable first step in modernising our approach to pet travel, reflecting the needs of today’s pet owners.
attributes.background: I urge the UK government to reconsider the current pet travel restrictions by permitting pets to enter and exit the UK from Europe with valid passports and health certificates, including proof of vaccinations and deworming. A pilot program at Liverpool Airport could facilitate this change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Pets can already travel freely from the UK to a EU country, and return to the UK from an EU country, as long as certain requirements are met such as gaining an animal health certificate. 

You can learn more about these requirements and rules for taking pets into the EU here: https://www.gov.uk/taking-your-pet-abroad

You can learn more about bringing a pet back to Great Britain here: https://www.gov.uk/bring-pet-to-great-britain/which-pet-travel-document 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
